name: Asmuth, Paul Andrew
title: General Manager
notes: Former CPA and partner at Pisenti & Brinker LLP. Seven-time World Professional Marathon Swimming Federation champion (1980-1985, 1988). Coached USA Swimming open water national team at 2008 Beijing and 2012 London Olympics. Author of 'Marathon Swimming: The Sport of the Soul'.

name: Burnham, Christopher
title: Co-Founder, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
ngos: Institute for Pension Fund Integrity (President); Marine Corps-Law Enforcement Foundation (Director); Center for Strategic and International Studies (Senior Advisor); Meridian International Center (former Director and Treasurer); EN+ Group International PJSC (Chairman of Board of Directors)
notes: Connecticut State Treasurer 1994-1997; Under Secretary-General for Management of the United Nations 2005-2006; Assistant Secretary of State for Resource Management and CFO of U.S. State Department; three-term Connecticut House of Representatives member; Vice Chairman and Managing Director Deutsche Asset Management 2006-2012; CEO of Columbus Circle Investors; US Marine Corps Reserve Lieutenant Colonel (retired); served as infantry platoon commander in Gulf War 1990; established first UN Ethics Office and UN whistleblower protection policy.

name: Burnham, Clark James
title: Partner (Name Partner)
notes: Name partner at Burnham Brown law firm in Oakland, California. Joined firm February 1970 following service as U.S. Army Captain. UCLA School of Law J.D., UC Berkeley B.A. California Bar license (#41792) became inactive December 31, 2015.

name: Chisholm, Jori Lance
title: Founder and Owner
notes: Born September 23, 1975. Professional bagpipe player and teacher based in Seattle, Washington. Founded BagpipeLessons.com in 1999; first piper to teach one-on-one video lessons (2003). US Gold Medal winner four times. Played with six-time Grade One World Champion Simon Fraser University Pipe Band. Founder of the World Online Piping & Drumming Championships. Inventor of Tone Protector reed case products. University of Puget Sound alumnus.

name: Coriston, James Michael
title: Retired Partner and Vice Chairman
ngos: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of San Francisco (Audit Committee and Finance Council); Capital Assets Support Corporation; Holy Cross Cemetery Advisory Board; Catholic Cemeteries (Board)
notes: Born February 29, 1940; died May 15, 2025. Joined Price Waterhouse 1965; admitted to partnership July 1, 1975. 35 years of service including San Francisco, San Jose, and five years in New York as PwC Vice Chairman. Returned to Bay Area 1994 as managing partner of San Francisco office; retired 2000. Post-retirement worked with Habitat for Humanity and Save the Children in Bolivia, Guatemala, and Honduras.

name: Dawson, William J.
title: Independent Director
ngos: Wellington Trust Co. NA (Director, since 2001); Nalu Medical Inc. (Independent Director, since 2021)
notes: Stanford University B.A. 1976; Harvard Business School MBA 1980. Independent Director at McGrath RentCorp since 1998. Former CFO at Adamas Pharmaceuticals (2014-2017, retired). Former CFO at Catalyst Biosciences (2010-2012). Former VP Finance and CFO at Cerus Corporation (2004-2009). 26 years in senior financial positions in biotechnology, healthcare services, investment banking, energy, and transportation.

name: Henninger, Daniel P.
title: Deputy Editorial Page Director
notes: Born in Cleveland, Ohio. Georgetown University Edmund A. Walsh School of Foreign Service alumnus. Joined Wall Street Journal 1977. Writes weekly 'Wonder Land' column. Fox News contributor and regular panelist on Journal Editorial Report. Pulitzer Prize finalist for editorial writing 1987 and 1996. Shared in WSJ Pulitzer Prize 2002 (Breaking News Reporting, September 11). Won Gerald Loeb Award for commentary (1985), ASNE Distinguished Writing Award for editorial writing (1995), National Journalism Award (1997), and Eric Breindel Journalism Award (2004).

name: Keil, Russell D. Jr.
notes: Resides in Belvedere Tiburon, California. Son of Russell D. Keil Sr., a San Francisco civic leader and executive (past president of Society of California Pioneers, Downtown Association, and Union Square Association).

name: Kibbey, Jason Turner
title: Director, Master of Climate Solutions Program
ngos: Sustainable Apparel Coalition (founding CEO); Freedom to Roam (Co-Founder and former interim Executive Director)
notes: Founded Sustainable Apparel Coalition and co-created the Higg Index (supply chain transparency tool). Founded Worldly (formerly Higg Co.), a sustainability measurement platform. Previously started career at Bain & Company. Co-founder of PACT apparel company. Appointed Director of UC Berkeley's Master of Climate Solutions (MCS) program, first cohort fall 2025. UC Berkeley B.S. environmental economics and policy; Haas School of Business MBA.

name: Pedley, Dean A.
notes: Resides in Larkspur, California. Companies registered at his address include Get Off The Ark Consulting Inc. and Ec Media Inc.

name: Pulling, Thomas L.
title: Chief Executive Officer, Smith Barney Investment Advisors (former)
ngos: Henry Luce Foundation (Board of Directors, since 1988); Woodlawn Cemetery (Board, since 1980); Long Island University (Trustee, since 1995); Council on Foreign Relations (member)
notes: Born March 1, 1939, New York City. Princeton University B.A. cum laude 1961. US Marine Corps 1962-1967. Career in finance: J.P. Morgan & Co. 1962-1968; New York Securities Co. VP 1968-1971; L.M. Rosenthal & Co. VP 1971-1976; Smith Barney Managing Director since 1977; CEO Smith Barney Investment Advisors since 1985.

name: Saveri, Richard Alexander
title: Managing Partner
ngos: Legal Aid Society (Board of Directors); University of San Francisco Board of Governors (2003-2006); American Bar Association (Antitrust Section); National Italian American Bar Association
notes: Born July 22, 1965 in San Francisco. University of Texas at Austin B.B.A. Finance; University of San Francisco J.D. Admitted California bar 1994. Managing partner of Saveri & Saveri Inc., a San Francisco antitrust and class action litigation firm founded 1959 by his grandfather Guido Saveri and great-uncle Richard Saveri. Selected to Super Lawyers 2019-2024. Son of the founding family of San Francisco's antitrust bar.

name: Schafer, H. James
title: General Partner / Managing Director
notes: Saint Mary's College of California B.A. Psychology 1966; MBA. 13 years at Coldwell Banker Commercial Real Estate (VP, founded and managed New England commercial brokerage operations in Boston). Several years as Managing General Partner, Lincoln Property Company, San Francisco (planned, leased, constructed and financed over 800,000 sq ft of high-rise office projects downtown SF). Co-founder of Samuelson Schafer (real estate development, management, consulting and investment in Northern California) since 1984; participated in development of over $500 million of projects. Offices in Kentfield and Los Angeles.

name: Washington, Gene A.
title: Director of Football Operations (former)
ngos: Goodrich Petroleum Corporation (Board of Directors, from 2003); Delia's Inc. (Board of Directors, from 2006); National Park Foundation (Board Member); New York Bancorp Inc. (Director); Home Federal Savings Bank (Director)
notes: Born January 14, 1947. Stanford University wide receiver 1966-1968 (led Pac-8 Conference in receptions, yards, and TDs as senior). NFL wide receiver: San Francisco 49ers 1969-1978 (4x Pro Bowl), Detroit Lions 1979. All-time 49ers leader in receiving yards (6,664), receptions (371), and TDs (59) at time of retirement. Assistant athletic director at Stanford mid-1980s to 1993. Director of Football Development NFL 1993; Director of Football Operations NFL 1994-2009. Ranked among Sports Illustrated's Most Influential Minorities in Sports (2003, 2004). Stanford Athletic Hall of Fame inductee. National Football Foundation Hall of Fame (2011).
